markdown: <::Cover page with a collage of hexagonal images featuring people working on technical installations. The top left shows a smiling man in a purple shirt. Below him, another man's face is visible. Further down, a man in a blue work uniform is shown, followed by a close-up of electrical wiring in a control box. The bottom left features a man in a blue jacket with 'GAA STR' on it, looking up and working. In the bottom right corner, the logo 'ROVC' is displayed with the tagline 'Technisch de beste opleider'. : collage::> Koelinstallaties, inspectie en onderhoud <::The logo 'ROVC' with the tagline 'Technisch de beste opleider'. : logo::>

<::A composite image showing two main scenes related to a cooling installation inspection. The left side of the image displays a heavily frosted evaporator coil inside a refrigerator or freezer, with ice buildup covering the fins and surrounding components. An inset image in the bottom left corner shows corroded electrical wiring, with red and black wires visible, indicating potential damage or wear. The right side of the main image shows two large, blue industrial compressors, part of a refrigeration system. They have copper piping connecting them, and electrical boxes are attached to their sides. One compressor has a yellow label with "73101332" written on it. The overall image suggests an inspection revealing issues with a cooling system. : figure::> Figuur 1 Inspectie koelinstallatie

<::Two circular blue mandatory action signs. The left sign shows an open book with an 'i' symbol inside, indicating information or instructions. The right sign shows a stylized person holding an open book, indicating to read the manual or instructions. : safety signs::>

<::A grid of eight blue circular mandatory safety signs with white pictograms. From left to right, top row: ear protection (earmuffs over a head), head protection (hard hat over a head), eye protection (safety glasses over a head), safety footwear (a work boot). Bottom row: safety footwear (a work boot, different style from above), respiratory protection (a gas mask over a head), hand protection (gloves), protective clothing (a full-body suit). : figure::>

<::Eye wash station sign: figure::> <::Emergency shower sign: figure::> <::Assembly point sign: figure::> <::Emergency exit sign with downward arrow: figure::> <::Emergency exit sign with running person and upward arrow: figure::>

<::A yellow rectangular sign with a black lightning bolt symbol pointing downwards. : figure::> <::A white rectangular sign with a yellow triangular warning symbol containing a black lightning bolt, and a yellow bar at the bottom with the text "230V". : figure::> <::A white rectangular sign with a yellow triangular warning symbol containing a black lightning bolt, and a yellow bar at the bottom with the text "400V". : figure::> <::A yellow rectangular sign with the black text "VERBODEN IN TE SCHAKELEN" (Forbidden to Switch On) arranged in three lines. : figure::>

<::Two warning signs. The left sign shows two interlocking circles, one larger than the other, inside a yellow triangle with a black border. The right sign shows a hand being caught by gears inside a yellow triangle with a black border.: figure::> Automatische detektie • Detectie niet overbruggen. • Sensoren niet afschermen of afplakken.

<::Three safety signs are displayed side-by-side. From left to right: 1. A yellow triangular warning sign with a black border and a black pictogram of a person bending over, indicating a hazard related to bending or low-level work. 2. A blue circular mandatory sign with a white border, featuring a white pictogram of an explosimeter (gas detector) with a dial and the text "EXPLOSIEMETER VERPLICHT" (Explosimeter Required) and "Ex.". 3. A blue circular mandatory sign with a white border, featuring a white pictogram of a person wearing a gas mask. : safety signs::>

<::Two triangular warning signs with black borders and yellow backgrounds. The left sign shows three wavy vertical lines above a horizontal line, indicating a hot surface. The right sign shows a snowflake symbol, indicating cold or frost.: figure::> **Table 1.1: Summary of the main characteristics of the different types of heat exchangers** <::Table content not provided in the image.: table::>

<::logo: ROVC ROVC Technisch de beste opleider The logo features the white text "ROVC" over a dark, blurred background that includes metallic elements and an olive green rectangular block, with smaller text "Technisch de beste opleider" below.::>

<::A close-up photograph shows a section of a building exterior with a light-colored brick wall. On the left, there's an electrical box with multiple gray cables emerging from it, secured with cable ties. To the right of these cables, a gray conduit or pipe is visible, from which a significant amount of white ice or frost is protruding, suggesting a problem with insulation on a cooling line. Further to the right, a wooden frame and a dark mesh screen are partially visible. : photo::> Figuur 5 Verouderde isolatie koelleiding

<::A close-up photograph shows a refrigeration system component, likely an expansion valve and associated copper piping, completely encased in a thick layer of white ice and frost. A small, light blue electrical box is visible on the right, attached to a wall or panel, with some wires and a U-shaped pipe connecting to it. In the background, partially obscured by ice, are what appear to be cooling fins. The overall scene suggests a malfunction or extreme operating conditions leading to significant ice buildup. Figuur 6 Expansieventiel volledig in ijs : figure::>

<::A digital thermometer (Testo 922) with a black body and a silver control panel is shown. It has a digital display showing "24.2". A black cable connects the thermometer to a grey and black handle, from which a long, thin metal probe extends. The Testo logo is visible on both the thermometer body and the probe handle. Figuur 8 Voorbeeld van een thermofiel : figure::>

<::image: Two manometers are displayed. The left manometer has a blue outer ring and a white face, showing scales for temperature and pressure. The temperature scale ranges from approximately -30 to +30 degrees Celsius, with visible markings at -10, 0, 10, 15, 20, 30. It also indicates "R410A" and "CLASSE SWISS MADE REFCO". The needle points to approximately 10. The right manometer has a red outer ring and a white face, also showing scales for temperature and pressure. The temperature scale ranges from approximately -30 to +60 degrees Celsius, with visible markings at -10, 0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60. The pressure scale ranges from 0 to 700, with visible markings at 100, 200, 300, 400, 600, 700. It also indicates "R410A" and "CLASSE SWISS MADE REFCO". The needle points to approximately 400. Both manometers have brass fittings and copper tubing extending downwards. Figuur 9 Voorbeeld van vaste manometer::>

<::A handheld hygro/luchtdebiet meter (hygro/airflow meter) is shown. The device is dark grey with a black wrist strap attached. At the top, there is a fan-like anemometer. Below it, a digital display shows "HALT-08" at the top, a large green number "50.4", and a smaller number "23.0". Below the display are several buttons: "Power", "Hold", "Max/Min", "Unit/Zero", "°C/°F", and "Function". At the bottom of the device, there is a white spherical sensor.: figure::> Figuur 10 Voorbeeld van hygro/luchtdebiet meter

<::A yellow and black Fluke Airflowmeter device is shown. The display screen shows "0.011" prominently, with "In H₂O" below it, and "72.5" below that. The top of the device has two ports. Below the screen, there is a green power button. To the right of the power button, there are several buttons arranged in columns and rows: - Top row: "PRESSURE", "VELOCITY", "FLOW VOLUME" - Middle row: "CLEAR", "RECALL", "CLEAR ALL" - Below "CLEAR": "HOLD" - Below "RECALL": "SAVE ENTER" - Below "CLEAR ALL": "CALC AVERAGE" - Bottom row: "SETUP UNITS", an up arrow button, a down arrow button, "MIN MAX", and "ZERO". : figure::>

<::A photograph shows two electrical measuring devices on a light gray surface. On the left is a yellow digital multimeter with a display showing "00.5". It has a large central rotary dial with various measurement ranges (e.g., V~, V-, A~, A-, Ω, hFE, Cx) and input jacks for black and red probes. The brand "Dynatek" and model "9004" are visible at the bottom. On the right is a blue clamp meter, labeled "EazyAmp" at the top and "NIEAF INSTRUMENT" at the bottom. It has a digital display showing "000", a clamp jaw, and several buttons (e.g., "VoltSense", "HOLD", "OFF"). It also has input jacks for probes. The black and red probes from the multimeter are visible, with their tips near the multimeter's input jacks. Figuur 12 Voorbeeld van voltmeter en amperetang : figure::>

<::A gray and black F-gas detection meter, labeled "YELLOW JACKET ACCUPROBE II", with a flexible black probe extending from one end and a pointed black tip on the other. The meter has a blue control panel with indicators for "Lo Bat", "Lo Norm Hi", and a yellow button labeled "Sensitivity" next to a power symbol.:figure::> Figuur 13 Voorbeeld van een F-gassen detectiemeter

<::A clear plastic dispenser containing a roll of phenolphthalein paper. The label on the dispenser reads: Cat No: 2600-204A Phenolphthalein paper Phenolphthaleinpapier Papier à la Phénolphtaléine Papel Fenolftaleína Whatman® Whatman International Ltd Whatman House, St Leonard's Road 20/20 Maidstone, Kent ME16 OLS England 0313 Figuur 14 Voorbeeld lakmoespapier : figure::>

<::A clear plastic specific gravity meter, or hydrometer, is shown horizontally against a light background. The device consists of a transparent cylindrical body with a blue plunger and needle-like tip on the left end, and a black, ribbed bulb with a D-shaped handle on the right end. Inside the transparent cylinder, near the center, a small red float or indicator is visible.: figure::> Figuur 15 Voorbeeld van een soortelijk gewicht meter

Refractometer Met deze meter kan het vriespunt van bijvoorbeeld glycol bepaald worden. <::A refractometer, a device used to measure the freezing point of liquids like glycol, is shown inside an open blue plastic case with a foam interior. The refractometer is silver and black, with a clear prism cover and an eyepiece. A small clear plastic dropper is also visible in the case. Figuur 16 Voorbeeld van een refractometer : figure::>

<::A photograph shows two large, light-colored industrial chiller units with the 'GEA' logo and 'R407C' visible on the left unit. The units have green horizontal stripes and various gauges and control panels. They are situated on a flat, possibly rooftop, surface with a yellow wall in the background and corrugated metal siding below it. Two large, insulated pipes extend from the right unit towards the foreground. The ground around the units appears wet or stained.::> Figuur 1 Chiller-unitgebouw

<::A pressure-enthalpy (p-h) diagram showing the phase envelope of a substance. The y-axis is labeled 'p' (pressure) and the x-axis is labeled 'h' (enthalpy). A dome-shaped curve represents the phase boundary, with a critical point (k.p) at its apex. The region to the left of the curve is labeled 'vloeistof' (liquid). The curve itself is divided into a 'vloeistoflijn' (liquid line) on the left and a 'verzadigde damplijn' (saturated vapor line) on the right. The area inside the dome is labeled 'vloeistof + damp' (liquid + vapor). The region to the right of the curve is labeled 'oververhit gas' (superheated gas). Figuur 2 Schets koelkringloop : diagram::>

<::A close-up image of a copper pipe with a brass check valve. The valve has a blue label with a white downward-pointing arrow and text that includes "EMERSON Climate Tech" and "Silence" partially visible in the background. The pipe appears to be part of a larger system or machine. : figure::> ___ Figuur 17

<::A close-up photograph of an industrial component, likely a pressure sensor or solenoid valve, attached to copper piping. The component has a red, cylindrical body with a black electrical connector on top. Below the red body, there is a metallic section with a white label that partially reads "Sep-20", "12456", and "V14BSFO". The copper tubing shows some discoloration and wear. Other machinery and pipes are visible in the background. : figure::>

<::A close-up image of a brass valve connected to a dark-colored pipe. The valve has "CROSBY" and other markings visible on its side. A copper pipe extends horizontally from the side of the brass valve. Below the valve, where it connects to the larger pipe, there is some dark, possibly corroded or sealed material. A small chain is attached to a part of the valve near the pipe connection, with a yellow tag or cap on the end of the chain. : figure::>

<::transcription of the content : A circular label with 'Danfoss' logo and 'MADE IN DENMARK' at the top. The left side shows 'TUBE' and '068U2022'. The right side shows 'R134a', '0.78 TR', and '2.7 kW'. A central circular element has a line extending diagonally downwards to the right. Below this, it reads '-40/+10°C -40/+50°F', 'PS 28 bar/MWP 400psig', and '096B'.::> Figuur 18 Technische gegevens op het expansieventiel

<::Three technical drawings of a Danfoss valve assembly. The top drawing shows a front view of the valve with a solenoid mounted on top, connected to horizontal pipes. The bottom drawing shows a bottom view of the valve body, also connected to horizontal pipes. The right drawing shows a side view of the valve, with the solenoid mounted horizontally to the side, connected to vertical pipes. The text "Danfoss A68F463.11" is present on the right side of the side view.: figure::>

<::Diagram showing an incorrect installation of a valve in a pipe system. A warning triangle with an exclamation mark is also present. The valve is connected to a horizontal pipe, and a vertical pipe connects to it. The entire valve assembly is crossed out with two diagonal lines, indicating it is forbidden or incorrect. Text on the valve reads "REGULATOR". Below the diagram, text reads "Danfoss A68F463.11".: figure::>
<::ELCO Made in Italy VNT 18-30 / 1615 E 08-08 230/240V~ 50/60Hz 18/73W 0,52A CL.B ROT.TERM. 1300/1550RPM VDE REG.- Nr. 4642 CE NET2T18PVN013 : label::>

<::diagram: The image displays a technical diagram illustrating the adjustment of pressure switches (pressostaten) from Danfoss. The diagram is divided into two main sections: LP (Low Pressure) and HP (High Pressure), each with settings for 'A' and 'B'. In the LP section: - A vertical scale on the left indicates 'Start', 'Diff.', and 'Stop' points. - Section 'A' is labeled 'CUT IN' and shows a scale with values in bar (0.7, 1, 2, 4, 6, 7.5, 10.6, 15.1) and psi (10, 15, 30, 60, 90, 110, 150, 220). - Section 'B' is labeled 'DIFF' and shows a scale with values in bar (0.35, 0.7, 1.5, 2.5, 3.5, 5.0, 7.0) and psi (5, 10, 20, 35, 50, 70, 100). In the HP section: - A vertical scale on the left indicates 'Stop', 'Diff.', and 'Start' points. - Section 'A' is labeled 'CUT OUT' and shows a scale with values in bar (10, 12, 18, 24, 28) and psi (150, 180, 250, 350, 400). - Section 'B' is labeled 'DIFF' and shows a scale with values in bar (6, 8, 10, 15, 20) and psi (70, 100, 150, 200, 300). On the right side of the diagram, a Danfoss pressure switch unit is depicted at the top, connected by dashed lines to a valve assembly on top of a pressure tank or cylinder. A pressure gauge is also shown connected to this assembly. Figuur 22 Afstellen pressostaten (bron Danfoss)::>

<::Image of an Elco-ventilatormotor (Elco fan motor). The motor is black with a gray plastic frame. A label on the motor shows the following specifications: NE 7-20-20 /080 E 30-01 230/240U ~ 50Hz 7/37W 0.22A CL.B PROT. IMP. 1220Rpm CE NPT2T072NN002 Figuur 23 Elco-ventilatormotor : figure::>

<::A close-up photograph of an electronic oil level regulator with a sight glass. The device is silver-colored and has a circular sight glass on the right, showing a yellowish liquid inside. To the left of the sight glass, there's a label with the following text: EMERSON Climate Technologies OM3-CCA TRA PCN 805033 P931 bar Below this, there are electrical specifications: 24V~ 0,7A And further down: LV 230V~ 3A There's also a 'CE' mark and 'Made in Australia'. Two black electrical connectors are plugged into the left side of the device. A blue cap with 'LIFT' written on it is visible at the bottom center. Various wires and pipes are seen around the device. The date '2011/07' is faintly visible on the metallic part near the sight glass. Figuur 25 Elektronische olieniveauregelaar met kijkglas::>

<::An electrical control valve, shown installed in a system with insulated pipes on the left, and a close-up of its label on the right. The label details are: ALCO CONTROLS EX6-M21 PCN 800621 Electrical Control Valve Elektrisches Regelventil U: 24 VDC PS: 60 bar TS: -50°C ... +100°C (UL -40°C ... +100°C) DN: 22mm x 28mm Fluid: HCFC, HFC / HFCKW,(H)FKW An arrow points to the left. Made in Czech Republic SN: 5A5402200008 KI : figure::> Figuur 1

<::A sign with the title "An Open Cooler Costs Money" and a subtitle "5 S's Sort-Segregate-Shine-Standardize-Sustain". Below the title, there is a list of costs associated with an open cooler: 10 Minutes = $1.50 20 Minutes = $3.00 30 Minutes = $4.50 1 Hour = $9.00 At the bottom, it says "KEEP DOOR CLOSED" and repeats the subtitle "Sort-Segregate-Shine-Standardize-Sustain". : sign::> Figuur 26 Besparing door goed gebruik

<::A large indoor storage facility with rows of wooden crates filled with carrots covered in soil. The crates are arranged in long rows, and in the background, there are stacks of empty wooden crates. The facility has white walls and a dark ceiling with fluorescent lighting. A green tarp-like material lines the sides of some of the storage areas. Figuur 27 Opslag groente met ademhalingswarmte (Bron Geerlofs) : figure::>

<::diagram of a cool cell with dimensions and a maximum load line. The diagram shows a side view of the cool cell. Key dimensions are indicated: - A height of 680 mm from the top to a horizontal line. - A height of 185 mm from the bottom to a horizontal line. - A total height of 2920 mm for the cool cell. - A length of 700 mm for a 'Side section'. - A length of 4180 mm for the main section. - An internal height of 1970 mm from the bottom to a horizontal line. - A red dashed line indicates 'Maximum load' starting from the 1970 mm height line and extending upwards to the 680 mm line. - An air circulation system is shown on the right, with an arrow indicating airflow to the left and a curved arrow indicating return flow. Figuur 28 Voorbeeld maximale hoogte in koelcel::>

<::diagram: Top Section The diagram shows a top-down view of a cold storage room with pallets arranged in two rows. The top row contains pallet positions labeled 1, 3, 5, 7, and 9. The bottom row contains pallet positions labeled 2, 4, 6, 8, and 10. A red dashed line is visible along the left side of the room. Figuur 29 Voorbeeld plaatsing van pallets in koelcel ::>

<::An outdoor refrigeration or HVAC unit is shown, featuring two large fans with protective grilles at the top. Below the fans, a horizontal pipe covered in patches of snow or ice runs across the image. To the left, a cylindrical receiver tank is visible, and to the right, a compressor unit with various pipes and valves, some of which are also covered in snow or ice. The unit appears to be in an outdoor setting with a concrete or dirt ground.: figure::> Figuur 30
<::Formula: COP = (Koelvermogen verdamper (Qo in kW)) / (Energieverbruik compressor (Vermogen P in kW))::>

<::h-log p diagram : chart:: Figuur 32 Meetgegevens in h log p-diagram **Chart Title**: R507 h-log p diagram **Refrigerant**: R507 **Source/Metadata**: Ref: Allied Signal, Genetron AZ 50, DTU, Department of Energy Engineering, s in [kJ/(kg K)], v in [m^3/kg], T in [°C], M.J. Skovrup & H.J.H Knudsen. 17-07-11 **Y-axis**: Pressure [Bar] - Scale: 2.00, 3.00, 4.00, 5.00, 6.00, 7.00, 8.00, 9.00, 10.00, 20.00, 30.00 **X-axis**: Enthalpy [kJ/kg] - Scale: 140, 160, 180, 200, 220, 240, 260, 280, 300, 320, 340, 360, 380, 400, 420, 440, 460 **Curves and Labels**: - **Isotherms (T in °C)**: Labeled curves for temperatures: -30, -20, -10, 0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60. - **Isochores (v in [m^3/kg])**: Labeled curves for specific volume: v=0.0020, v=0.0030, v=0.0040, v=0.0050, v=0.0060, v=0.0070, v=0.0080, v=0.0090, v=0.010, v=0.015, v=0.020, v=0.030, v=0.040, v=0.050, v=0.060, v=0.070, v=0.080, v=0.090, v=0.10. - **Isentropes (s in [kJ/(kg K)])**: Labeled curves for entropy: s=1.00, s=1.65, s=1.70, s=1.75, s=1.80, s=1.85, s=1.90, s=1.95. - **Quality lines (x)**: Labeled curves for quality: x=0.10, x=0.20, x=0.30, x=0.40, x=0.50, x=0.60, x=0.70, x=0.80, x=0.90. **Highlighted Region**: A red polygon outlines a specific region on the diagram, representing a thermodynamic cycle or operating range. The vertices of this polygon are approximately at: - (228 kJ/kg, 2.00 Bar) - (357 kJ/kg, 2.00 Bar) - (418 kJ/kg, 10.00 Bar) - (365 kJ/kg, 10.00 Bar) - (228 kJ/kg, 2.00 Bar) (closing the loop) ::>
